meanings.definition: The position or location of a gun being pointed at someone.
meanings.sent1: He felt scared when the robber held him at gunpoint.
meanings.sent2: The criminal demanded money at gunpoint.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain always put the hero in danger at gunpoint.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words hit me at gunpoint, leaving me speechless.
meanings.sent5: The image of the gunpoint stayed in his mind long after the incident.

meanings.definition: The act of threatening or forcing someone to do something by using a gun.
meanings.sent1: The hostage situation ended peacefully without any harm at gunpoint.
meanings.sent2: The detective negotiated with the criminal at gunpoint.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy bank robber accidentally pointed the gun at himself at gunpoint.
meanings.sent4: The ultimatum was given at gunpoint, leaving no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room rose as the criminal held everyone at gunpoint.
